edu.bu.segrelab.comets
Class DoubleField

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.text.JTextComponent
                  javax.swing.JTextField
                      edu.bu.segrelab.comets.DoubleField
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class DoubleField
extends javax.swing.JTextField

A JTextField extension that only allows double values to be entered into the box. There is also a separate toggle to allow only positive or also negative values. There is also an IntField available.

Author:
briehl
See Also:
IntField, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

DoubleField

public DoubleField(boolean allowNegative)
Constructs a new DoubleField.

Parameters:
allowNegative - - if true, allow negative numbers to be entered.

DoubleField

public DoubleField(int cols,
                   boolean allowNegative)
Constructs a new DoubleField with a given number of columns.

Parameters:
cols - - number of columns in the field.
allowNegative - - if true, allow negative numbers to be entered.

DoubleField

public DoubleField(double initialValue,
                   boolean allowNegative)
Constructs a new DoubleField, initialized with some value. Note that if the initial value is negative and allowNegative is false, no error will be thrown. So check your variables before initializing!

Parameters:
initialValue - - initial value this field will hold.
allowNegative - - if true, allow negative numbers to be entered.

DoubleField

public DoubleField(double initialValue,
                   int cols,
                   boolean allowNegative)
Constructs a new DoubleField with some initial value and a given number of columns.

Parameters:
initialValue - - initial value this field will hold.
cols - - number of columns in the field.
allowNegative - - if true, allow negative numbers to be entered.
Method Detail

processKeyEvent

public void processKeyEvent(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
Overrides JTextField's processKeyEvent() method to only allow decimal numbers to be entered in the field. Also, if the allowNegative parameter was set to false in the constructor, then the '-' signifying a negative number is not allowed.

Overrides:
processKeyEvent in class javax.swing.JComponent

getDoubleValue

public double getDoubleValue()
Returns the value currently in the field as a double.

Returns:
a double from the DoubleField
